thread.title: Adele halts George Michael tribute performance at the Grammys 2017 after singing out of tune | London Evening Standard
thread.title_full: Adele halts George Michael tribute performance at the Grammys 2017 after singing out of tune | London Evening Standard

author: Ben Travis
title: Adele halts George Michael tribute performance at the Grammys 2017 after singing out of tune | London Evening Standard
text:
Adele halts George Michael tribute performance at the Grammys 2017 after singing out of tune 
The singer re-started her performance after she ‘f it up’ on the first go Monday 13 February 2017 07:32 GMT Click to follow Smoke pours from double-decker bus fire on busy north London street 
Adele had to re-start her tribute to George Michael at the Grammys after saying she ‘f it up’ on her first attempt. 
The British singer was performing Michael’s 1996 song Fastlove at the awards ceremony, but was out of tune with her live accompaniment. 
After performing the first verse, she halted the live show during the chorus and asked to start again. 
“I know it’s live TV I’m sorry, I need to start again,” she admitted. “I f it up.” (Matt Sayles/Invision/AP) 
Referring to her troubled performance of All I Ask at the 2016 Grammys where she suffered from sound issues, Adele continued: “I can’t do it again like last year. Grammy Awards 2017 - In pictures Grammy Awards 2017 - In pictures 1/62

“I’m sorry for swearing and I’m sorry for starting again, can we please start it again?
